info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:37PM EDT until June 18 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR JONES...SOUTHEASTERN LENOIR...CRAVEN...SOUTHEASTERN PITT... ONSLOW...SOUTHERN BEAUFORT...SOUTHERN DUPLIN...WESTERN CARTERET AND SOUTHWESTERN PAMLICO COUNTIES... At 835 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Washington to near Phillips Crossroads to near Potters Hill to near Harrells, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, New Bern, Washington, Wallace, Pumpkin Center, Piney Green, New River Station, River Road, Half Moon, Camp Lejeune Center, James City, Trent Woods, River Bend, Stella, Swansboro, Phillips Crossroads, Hubert, Rose Hill, Richlands and Beulaville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage near Farmville, Walstonburg and areas that were impacted by the same line of thunderstorms. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
